thread.title: Sony brings Android TV range to India at a starting price of Rs 69,900
thread.title_full: Sony brings Android TV range to India at a starting price of Rs 69,900 | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: Sony brings Android TV range to India at a starting price of Rs 69,900
text:
Other Articles CDR cell case Visa Steel seeks passport in strategic investor Vedanta says its Cairn India buyout offer is fair China prepares 'California-style' scheme for green cars Sony India has brought its new range of Android TVs to India in both Full HD and 4K screen options.
The company has also announced the World’s Slimmest TV, the BRAVIA 4K LED with a 4.9mm thickness, for the Indian market.
The Sony Android TVs uses the official Google Android OS- 5.0 version giving users the ability to stream content, downloap apps and use voice search. It also interacts seamlessly with other smart devices and even beams content from those sources.
For the Indian market Sony has added the Serial Abtak app that will let you catch up with television soaps from popular channels. There is even the Notify BRAVIA options that shows notifications from linked smart devices on the larger screen.
The new models range from 43 inch to 75 inch and include 5 new series with 13 new models. The KDL-50W950C has been priced Rs 132,900, the KDL-43W950C at Rs 82,900, KDL-55W800C at Rs 154,900 and KDL-43W800C at Rs 69,900. These models are now available in Indian market. Other models will follow in coming weeks.
The Sony BRAVIA 4K LED has also not been priced.
Read first impressions review here
 23, 2015 5:42 pm © The Indian Express Online Media Pvt Ltd
